dt.t: had been {it}hustled{/it} into a jail cell with the other protesters
… grabbed him by the arm and {it}hustled{/it} him out the door …
{it}hustling{/it} tourists from one museum to the next
{wi}hustle{/wi} up new customers
try to {wi}hustle{/wi} up some tickets to tonight's game
{it}hustling{/it} up some grub

dt: {bc}to sell something to or obtain something from (someone) by energetic and especially underhanded activity {bc}{sx|swindle||}

dt.t: {it}hustling{/it} the suckers
an elaborate scam to {wi}hustle{/wi} the elderly

dt: {bc}to sell or promote energetically and aggressively

dt.t: {it}hustling{/it} a new product

dt: {bc}to lure less skillful players into competing against oneself at (a gambling game)

dt.t: {wi}hustle{/wi} pool
you'd better {wi}hustle{/wi} if you want to catch the bus

dt: {bc}to make strenuous efforts to obtain especially money or business

dt.t: Our quartet was out {it}hustling{/it} … and we knew we stood good to take in a lot of change before the night was over.

dt: {bc}to obtain money by fraud or deception
{bc}to play a game or sport in an alert aggressive manner

dt.t: She's not the most talented player on the team, but she always {wi}hustles{/wi}.

et: Dutch {it}husselen{/it} to shake, from Middle Dutch {it}hutselen{/it}, frequentative of {it}hutsen{/it}
shortdef: to crowd or push roughly : jostle, shove

dt.t: I … went about the {wi}hustle{/wi} of summer life.
You stepped out of Penn Station into the dizzying {wi}hustle{/wi} of Eighth Avenue …
I enjoy the {phrase}hustle and bustle{/phrase} of the city.

dt: {bc}effort and energy in playing a sport

dt.t: a baseball player who has been criticized for lack of {wi}hustle{/wi}
The fans admire them for their {wi}hustle{/wi}.
a player known more for his {wi}hustle{/wi} than his talent
Now, the secret of any {wi}hustle{/wi} is that you have to have information that the other guy doesn't have.
… a once-inspired con man on his last {wi}hustle{/wi} …

shortdef: effort and energy in playing a sport
a dishonest plan for getting money : scam

dt.t: I'll try to {it}hustle up{/it} some tickets to tonight's game.
Let's see if we can {it}hustle up{/it} some lunch.
